ygData.subject: Final Tally: Proposal: Move unit tests to own directory.
ygData.msgSnippet: I ll close the polls on the move unit tests proposal.  Here s the final tally: In favor of moving unit tests: 3 votes (Christian, Tom Emerson, and Kris).

Subject: Final Tally: Proposal: Move unit tests to own directory.
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=168599281

I'll close the polls on the 'move unit tests' proposal.  Here's the 
final tally:

In favor of moving unit tests:
       
    3 votes (Christian, Tom Emerson, and Kris).

Against moving unit tests:
   
    3 votes (Igor, Gordon, and John Erik and bergmark_d w/ 0.5 votes each).

Since there is no clear majority, lets leave the tests where they are 
for now.

Consensus seems to have it that we revisit this decision when src tree 
has more unit test classes that we currently have (We're coming up on 
~20%, as Christian has stated).  Lets revisit when unit test classes are 
above 30% or just before a scheduled spate of rabid unit test class 
additions.

Thanks to all for the votes.

Christian Kohlschuetter wrote:

> ...
>
> Also, remember, test cases currently show up in the API javadocs, 
> where they
> shouldn't be. For a novice, this makes getting an overview unnecessarily
> complicated.

I just fixed this.

Yours,
St.Ack
